current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize appropriations for fiscal year
		  2014 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States
		  Government and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence, the Central
		  Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other
		  purposes.

header.#text: Reports on chemical weapons in Syria

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report on the Syrian chemical weapons program.

text.#text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

text.#text: A comprehensive assessment of chemical weapon stockpiles in Syria, including names, types, and quantities of chemical weapons agents, types of munitions, and location and form of storage, production, and research and development facilities.
A listing of key personnel associated with the Syrian chemical weapons program.
An assessment of undeclared chemical weapons stockpiles, munitions, and facilities.
An assessment of how these stockpiles, precursors, and delivery systems were obtained.
A description of key intelligence gaps related to the Syrian chemical weapons program.
An assessment of any denial and deception efforts on the part of the Syrian regime related to its chemical weapons program.
